Name of Action: Department of Ed reinstates all 65 probationary employees it terminated but places all on administrative leave
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Employees reinstated under court order, with back pay.
What It Means: Federal government claims it is taking time to reintegrate terminated employees but still hopes to permanently fire them pending the appeals process.
Status: Federal government is appealing the court decision.
News & Commentary: Court Records Show How Many Federal Workers were Fired and Rehired at 18 Agencies

Name of Action: Federal judge orders reinstatement of $600 million in funds for teacher preparation programs
Topic: Program Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, PK-12 Schools, Educator Workforce
What It Says: Judge ordered ED to restore funding to Supporting Effective Educator Development program, Teacher Quality Partnership Program, Teacher and School Leader incentive program.
What It Means: Important legal victory for educator preparation programs, which would have been financially devastated by these cuts. Unknown whether ED will appeal.
News & Commentary: Judge Orders Education Dept. to Restore Teacher Prep Grants

Name of Action: Federal agents deport Rasha Alawieh, a Brown University Professor and U.S. work visa holder, despite judge's order
Topic: Antisemitism, Civil Rights, Postsecondary, Immigration
What It Says: Prosecutors claim she was detained for attending the funeral of a Hezbollah leader while in Lebanon.
What It Means: Demonstrates that Trump Adminstration is acting on grounds that judges and legal watchers claim are spurious.
News & Commentary: Brown University professor deported despite judge’s order, defying US court | Trump administration | The Guardian

Name of Action: Continuing the Reduction of the Federal Bureaucracy
Topic: Early Childhood, Program Funding, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Calls for the elimination of all non-statutory components of the Institute for Museum and Library Sciences, among other agencies.
What It Means: Threatens numerous educational programs including summer learning and early literacy development.
News & Commentary: ALA statement on White House assault on the Institute of Museum and Library Services

Name of Action: Office of Civil Rights Initiates Title VI Investigations into Institutions of Higher Education
Topic: DEI, Civil Rights, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary
What It Says: Targets 45 institutions that partner with The PhD Project, 6 universities for awarding allegedly race-based scholarships, and one program that ED alleges segregates students on the basis of race.
What It Means: ED is instituting investigations for DEI efforts that it says are in violations of the Feb. 14 Dear Colleague letter.
News & Commentary: More than 50 universities face federal investigations as part of Trump's anti-DEI campaign | AP News

Name of Action: Department of Ed issues joint letter to Columbia University demanding steps in response to what ED calls Antisemitism
Actor/Authorizer: Dept of Ed, HHS, Gen Services Admin
Topic: Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, Research Funding, Academic Freedom
What It Says: Demands include adopting a formal definition of Antisemitism; banning masks for protesters; and putting Middle East, South Asian, and African Studies Department under academic receivership for a minimum of five years.
What It Means: Continued scrutiny of institutions where protests against the Israel-Hamas War took place. Amounts to an ultimatum to keep federal funding.
Additional Info: University Statement Regarding UJB Determinations | Office of Public Affairs

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Hosts Meeting with Detransitioners and Advocates on Detrans Awareness Day
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights
What It Says: "Listening session" with individuals who have reversed their gender transition and Sec. Linda McMahon. Also a meeting with other officials from HHS and ED.
What It Means: Continuance of federal actions to roll back civil rights protections for trans people.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Initiates Reduction in Force
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Department says that it has reduced its workforce by nearly half, from 4,133 to 2,183 staff members. This includes separations through layoffs, voluntary resignations, and retirements.
What It Means: Appears Department is cutting most or all initiatives that are not required by statute.
Status: Lawsuit filed by 20 states and District of Columbia on 3/13.
News & Commentary: Education Department cutting nearly half of workforce | CNN Politics

Name of Action: Department of Education orders all department offices temporarily closed for the following day.
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Memo sent to all employees says that closures are for "security reasons." Employees instructed to take their laptops and work from home.
What It Means: More disruptions and uncertainty for Department of Ed employees.
News & Commentary: Department of Education offices to temporarily close for ‘security reasons’ with Trump’s plan to dismantle agency looming | CNN Politics

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Agriculture cuts off tens of millions of dollars in grants to University of Maine System.
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Research Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary
What It Says: Claims a review of grants for Title VI and Title IX violations.
What It Means: More retribution against Maine's defense of trans civil rights.
News & Commentary: University of Maine System’s USDA funding ‘temporarily’ paused

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education's Office for Civil Rights Sends Letters to 60 Universities Under Investigation for Antisemetic Discrimination and Harassment
Topic: Research Funding, Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary
What It Says: Letter warns of "potential enforcement actions if they do not fulfill their obligations under Title VI of the Civil Rights Act to protect Jewish students on campus. . ." Letters sent to all 60 institutions currently "under investigation or monitoring."
What It Means: Continued scrutiny of institutions where protests against the Israel-Hamas War took place.
News & Commentary: Ed Department Warns Harvard of ‘Potential Enforcement Actions’ Over Antisemitism Complaints | News

Name of Action: Federal immigration agents detain Mahmoud Khalil, a Columbia University graduate student and U.S. green card holder
Topic: Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary, Immigration
What It Says: Detained on State Department order for potential deportation, claiming his presence in the U.S. could have "adverse foreign policy consequences." Authorities also revoked visa of another Columbia student.
What It Means: Continued scrutiny of institutions where protests against the Israel-Hamas War took place.
Challenges to Action: Mahmoud Khalil v. Donald J. Trump - NYCLU
News & Commentary: Mahmoud Khalil calls himself political prisoner after US immigration arrest | Reuters

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Agriculture proposes $660 million in cuts to meal programs for childcare facilities
Topic: Early Childhood, Program Funding, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Program provides funds to states to purchase local domestic foods for schools and childcare centers.
What It Means: Presents a major funding gap for providing meals for children.
News & Commentary: Proposed School Meal Cuts Prompt Nationwide Advocacy
Additional Info: USDA plans big cuts to food bank, school food programs: What to know

Name of Action: Restoring Public Service Loan Forgiveness
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights, Immigration, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Directs Secretary of Education to propose revisions to the program, including barring certain non-profit service from eligibility
What It Means: Looks to undermine work of non-profit organizations that support issues like immigrant rights, DEI, and trans individuals.
News & Commentary: What student loan borrowers should know as Trump targets Public Service Loan Forgiveness

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education's Office for Civil Rights Launches Initiative to Address Backlog of Biden Administration-Era Complaints Alleging Antisemitism
Topic: Research Funding, Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Continued scrutiny of institutions where protests against the Israel-Hamas War took place.

Name of Action: DOJ, HHS, ED, and GSA Announce Initial Cancelation of Grants and Contracts to Columbia University Worth $400 Million
Actor/Authorizer: Dept of Ed, HHS, Department of Justice
Topic: Research Funding, Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Agencies cited what they said was "continued inaction in the face of persistent harassment of Jewish students."
What It Means: Cuts came a mere 4 days after the investigation way opened. Sends a strong signal to other institution that the adminstration is willing to exact financially devastating cuts.
News & Commentary: Trump administration cancels $400M in grants and contracts with Columbia University | AP News
Additional Info: Federal Funding Cuts to Columbia Set Dangerous Precedent, ACE Warns

Name of Action: Linda McMahon confirmed as Sec of Education
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Vote was 51-45 along party lines.
What It Means: McMahon issued a letter laying out the Department's "final mission."

Name of Action: Office for Civil Rights Launches Title IX Investigation into Washington State School District
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Tumwater School District investigated for allowing trans athletes to compete in girls' sports.
Status: Since investigation announced, district voted to bans trans athletes from girls' sports.
News & Commentary: Tumwater School District bans trans athletes from girls’ teams – KIRO 7 News Seattle

Name of Action: ED, HHS, and GSA Announce Additional Measure to End Anti-Semitic Harassment on College Campuses
Topic: Research Funding, DEI, Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary
What It Says: Comprehensive review of Columbia University's federal grants and contracts.
What It Means: Actions in response to Columbia University's handling of campus protests against the Israel-Hamas War in Spring 2024.
News & Commentary: Trump threatens to ax $54.1M in contracts with Columbia

Name of Action: Designating English as the Official Language of the United States
Topic: Civil Rights, DEI, Regulations, Immigration, Curriculum, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Revokes EO 13166 of 2000 (Improving Access to Services for Persons with Limited English Proficiency). Does not require that agencies stop offering communications and services in Languages other than English but empowers agencies to stop if they so choose.
What It Means: Cause for concern that multilingual teaching and programming in PK-12 classrooms maybe be threatened, particularly for students from immigrant families.
News & Commentary: Trump signs executive order making English the official language of the U.S.

Name of Action: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) cuts funding to Maine Sea Grant
Topic: Research Funding, LGBTQ+, DEI, Civil Rights, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary
What It Says: Coastal research program housed at University of Maine since 1971.
What It Means: Critics argue that this action is retribution for Maine governor's resolve to stand by policies that protect trans athletes.
News & Commentary: NOAA ends funding for Maine Sea Grant, citing shift in priorities

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Announces Additional Trump-Vance Appointees
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Sarah Urspring; Hayley Sanon; Steven Schaefer; David Samberg; Andrew Cuff; Murray Bessette; Ellen Keast

Name of Action: Federal Task Force to Combat Antisemitism Announces Visits to 10 College Campuses that Experiences Incidents of Antisemitism
Topic: Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary
What It Says: (See list to the right) Targetting campuses that were sites of students protests against the Israel-Hamas War in Spring 2024.
What It Means: Federal government investigating higher education administrations. Important implications for academic freedom and student First Amendment rights.
News & Commentary: Federal Task Force to Combat Antisemitism to Visit Northwestern, 9 other Schools
Additional Info: Columbia University; George Washington University; Harvard University; Johns Hopkins University; New York University; Northwestern University; the University of California, Los Angeles; the University of California, Berkeley; the University of Minnesota; and the University of Southern California.

Name of Action: Frequently Asked Questions about Racial Preferences and Stereotypes Under Title VI of the Civil Rights Act
Topic: DEI, Civil Rights, Program Funding, Curriculum, Academic Freedom, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Follows up on February 14 Dear Colleague letter. Elaborates on several points, including case law used as support. States that ED does not control school curricula and that cultural celebrations are permitted if open to all.
What It Means: As with the Dear Colleague letter, this is not legally binding.

Name of Action: Federal reduction in force buyout offers
Topic: Federal Workforce
What It Says: Offered employees up to $25,000, which for many employees would amount to less than severance and unused leave compensation. Offer was rescinded and then reinstated.
What It Means: Email states that employees can accept $25,000 to leave or retire OR accept severancy, whichever is less. Offer email has caused confusion and uncertainty across the Department.
News & Commentary: US education department offers buyout that employees call ‘beyond misleading’ | US news | The Guardian
Fallout: EX: Drain of expertise at NSF's Office of Inspector General and HHS's Office of Research Integrity

Name of Action: HHS Rescinds Policy on Public Participation in Rulemaking
Topic: Regulations, Governance
What It Says: Eliminates opportunity to comment on agency plans.
What It Means: Threatens transparency of the department and public voice. Could impact educational programs run by HHS like Head Start and child welfare.
News & Commentary: RFK Jr. moves to eliminate public comment in HHS decisions | STAT

Name of Action: Department of Justice opens investigations into University of Michigan and University of California system for allegations of bias against Jewish employees
Topic: Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Postsecondary
What It Says: Section 707 of Title VII of Civil Rights Act to investigate allegations of a hostile work environment.
What It Means: Such investigations are usually slow and time-consuming, but DoJ is moving quickly with these.
News & Commentary: DOJ Probes University of Michigan for Workplace Antisemitism

Name of Action: DOGE cuts grants for apprenticeship programs
Topic: Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, Research Funding
What It Says: $18 million cut under 3 contract terminations "for convenience"
What It Means: The Trump Administration has said it will prioritize workforce training, but these cuts call that into question.
News & Commentary: More Apprenticeship Cuts

Name of Action: Department of Labor disbands Advisory Council on Apprenticeship
Topic: Regulations, Governance, Postsecondary
What It Says: 30-member panel comprised of wide range of stakeholders plus ex-officio members from numerous federal agencies
What It Means: Part of broad federal practice of terminating advisory councils it deems

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Launches "End DEI" Portal
Topic: DEI, Title IX, Civil Rights, Regulations, PK-12 Schools, Postsecondary
What It Says: Portal for public to submit complaints about DEI in educational institutions.
What It Means: YIKES.

Name of Action: USDA reinstates 1890 National Scholars Program
Topic: DEI, Civil Rights, Program Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: USDA scholarship for rural Black students attending HBCUs had been suspended days before "pending further review."
What It Means: Trump admin has stated that it's committed to protecting HBCUs but not other minority-serving institutions, and they're targeting race-conscious efforts across the PK-20 landscape.
News & Commentary: Under pressure, White House reinstates HBCU scholars program

Name of Action: Department of Ed Puts Peggy Carr, Commissioner on NCES, on leave
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: No reason given.
What It Means: IES, which oversees NCES, has essentially been shut down. Unclear what implications will be for NAEP, among many other programs.
News & Commentary: Trump suspends the head of 'The Nation's Report Card'

Name of Action: Department of Agriculture launches compliance review of University of Maine
Topic: Research Funding, LGBTQ+, DEI, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Notice states that the University is under investigation for "blatant disregard for President Trump's Executive Order 14201 'Keeping Men out of Women's Sports".
What It Means: Appears to be continued retribution against Maine for defending rights of trans women and girls to compete in women's and girls sports.

Name of Action: Office for Civil Rights Launches Title IX Violation Investigations into Maine Department of Education and Maine School District
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary, PK-12 Schools, State Jurisdiction
What It Says: Investigating state and district for allowing trans athletes to compete in girls sports.
What It Means: More attacks on trans students and athletes. Ongoing legal battles put state athletic associations in a complex position.
News & Commentary: Maine to defy Trump order, will allow transgender athletes to play girls sports

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Reduces Federal Overreach in Charter Schools Program
Topic: School Choice, Regulations, PK-12 School Funding, PK-12 Schools, State Jurisdiction
What It Says: Rescinds Biden-admin regulations on state oversight of postsecondary institutions that authorize charter schools and Charter School Program grants. Removed threat of loss of funding for South Carolina for not meeting these regulations.
What It Means: Less regulation of charter school sector.

Name of Action: Linda McMahon Advances to Full-Senate Vote
Topic: Department of Education
What It Says: Party-line vote 12-11.
What It Means: Assures a close but likely confirmation.

Name of Action: Dept of Ed cancels NAEP for 17 year-olds
Topic: Research Funding, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Cancels NAEP of 17 year-olds. That group hasn't been tested since 2012 due to Covid-era cancelation. Was set to run March-May 2025.
What It Means: Losing key data points in longitudinal understandings of academics for 17 year-olds. This might have legal implications, as NAEP is law.
News & Commentary: After Declaring NAEP Off-Limits, Education Department Cancels Upcoming Test – The 74

Name of Action: National Labor Relations Board rescinds 2021 memo stating that certain NCAA student athletes should be considered employees under the law
Topic: Regulations, Postsecondary, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Impacts the rights of NCAA student athletes.
News & Commentary: NLRB rescinds stack of Biden-era enforcement memos | HR Dive

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Cancels Divisive and Wasteful Grants under the Comprehensive Centers Program
Topic: Research Funding, PK-12 School Funding, Curriculum
What It Says: Department claims that these centers were developing and providing materials on divisive concepts. 18 grants in total.
What It Means: Department is cutting grants for contractors who support DEI policies, practices, and initiatives. Appears the contracts were cut through a review of their grant applications.
News & Commentary: Trump Education Department cancels $226 million in 'divisive' diversity grants - Washington Times

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Updates Guidance on Covid-19 Funding
Topic: PK-12 Schools, PK-12 School Funding, Regulations
What It Says: States will be required to pay for expenses that were already earmarked for Covid-19 funding and then apply for reimbursement from the federal government. Could impact about $1.7 million in funding.
What It Means: Major shift from original intention of funding and might introduce financial risk for states if Department of Ed denies reimbursement claims.
News & Commentary: ED Announces Policy Shift in Dispersing Late COVID-relief Dollars | AASA

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Cuts over $600 million in Divisive Teacher Training Grants
Topic: Research Funding, DEI, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, Curriculum, Academic Freedom, Postsecondary Funding, Educator Workforce
What It Says: Cuts in grants to teacher preparation programs that provide instruction in CRT, DEI, anti-racism, white supremacy, LGBTQ+ issues, ablism, and other justice-oriented principles.
What It Means: Financial repercussions for postsecondary institutions who continue to adhere to their justice-oriented values.
Status: Court ordered reinstatement of funding on 3/17/25.
News & Commentary: Trump slashed teacher training, citing DEI. Educators say the grants fought staff shortages
Additional Info: Legal challenge brought by AACTE on 3/3. TRO issued on 3/12 in another case brought by 8 states.

Name of Action: Keeping Education Accessible and Ending Covid-19 Vaccine Mandates in Schools
Topic: Regulations, Healthcare, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Halts federal funding for schools requiring Covid-19 vaccination for in-person learning.
What It Means: Restricts schools' ability to make decisions that protect public health.

Name of Action: OCR Dear Colleague letter on race-conscious policies and practices
Topic: Research Funding, DEI, Civil Rights, Program Funding, Regulations, Curriculum, Academic Freedom, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Threatens to withhold funding from PK-20 educational institutions and organizations that include race as a factor in any decisions or programming. Gives institutions 14 days to comply.
What It Means: Not legally binding. Still, institutions are working to assess implications of the letter and whether and to what extent they need to comply.
News & Commentary: AFT sues Education Department over anti-DEI guidance | Higher Ed Dive
Notes: AFT bringing suit against ED (Column K). NEA and ACLU bringing suit against ED (Column M).

Name of Action: Linda McMahon HELP Confirmation Hearing
Topic: Department of Education
What It Says: Relatively short hearing. Great deal of pushback from Dems. Generally strong support and unity from GOP.
What It Means: Little pushback from GOP makes confirmation even more likely.
Challenges to Action: Several interuptions of hearing by hecklers.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Cancels Additional $350 Million in Woke Spending
Topic: PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Program Funding, DEI, Research Funding
What It Says: Canceled contracts with Regional Education Laboratories, which provide technical assistance to schools.
What It Means: Claims that these agencies provide too much assistance for equity-focused work like equity audits.

Name of Action: Layoffs of Probationary Federal Employees
Topic: Federal Workforce, Regulations, Civil Rights
What It Says: Layoffs of probationary employees from ED, Bureau of Indian Education, CFPB
What It Means: Beginning of major reduction in ED workforce. Implications for OCR, financial aid, legal, communications.
Status: 3/13 rulling by federal judge reinstates employees at Veterans Affairs, Agriculture, Defense, Energy, Interior, and Treasury. Does not cover ED, but judge could extend ruling to those employees.
Challenges to Action: Pueblo of Isleta v Secretary of the Department of the Interior
News & Commentary: Tribal funding caught in crossfire from Trump administration - ICT News
Additional Info: Student loan borrowers misled by colleges were about to get relief. Trump fired people poised to help

Name of Action: U.S. State Department freezes funding for study abroad programs, including Fulbright
Topic: Research Funding, Program Funding, Postsecondary Funding, Postsecondary, International Education
What It Says: Actions claims that program funding was frozen pending a 14-day review, but that window expired on February 27, 2025.
What It Means: Funding freeze has impacted tens of thousands of scholars, with some of them stranded outside their home countries.
Status: Many organizations and institutions report that funding is still frozen.
News & Commentary: Statement: Suspension of International Education and Exchange Program Funding Threatens U.S. Economic and National Security | NAFSA
Additional Info: Scholars stranded in America and abroad amid funding freeze of State Department programs | AP News

Name of Action: Establishing the President's Make America Healthy Again Commission
Topic: Regulations, Healthcare, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Assessing "prevalence and threats posed" by mental health treatments like medications, particularly for minors.
What It Means: Questioning mental health professionals' ability to treat children.

Name of Action: U.S Department of Education Rescinds Biden 11th Hour Guidance on NIL Compensation
Topic: DEI, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary
What It Says: Rescinds Biden admin regulations that required NIL money from college sports to be distributed equally among male and female athletes. Claims Title IX does not apply to NIL.
What It Means: Trump adminstration casting aside gender pay equity in collegiate atheletics.
News & Commentary: Dept. of Education revokes guidance on Title IX and athlete pay - ESPN

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Launches Investigation into Two Athletics Organizations
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Regulations, Postsecondary, State Jurisdiction
What It Says: Investigations into associations in Minnesota and California for allowing students to compete in sports events that conform to their gender identity.
What It Means: More attacks on trans students and athletes. Ongoing legal battles put state athletic associations in a complex position.
News & Commentary: The U.S. Department of Education targets two athletic associations over girls' and women's sports

Name of Action: Department of Education launches investigation into 5 VA school districts' trans athelete policies
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Regulations, PK-12 Schools, State Jurisdiction
What It Says: Pursuent to a complaint filed by America First Legal Foundation alleging that the five districts continue to support trans athlete participation in sports.
What It Means: ED is pursuing complaints filed by independent entitities.
News & Commentary: Education Department investigating Northern Virginia school districts for transgender support policies
Notes: Primary source is ED letter to America First Legal Foundation.

Name of Action: Nomination of Kirsten Baesler for Assistant Secretary for Elementary and Secondary Education
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Description in title.
News & Commentary: CCSSO Releases Statement on Nomination of Assistant Secretary for Elementary and Secondary Education

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Urges the NCAA, UFHS Female Athletics Records Wrongfully Erased By Male Competitors
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary
What It Says: Urges school athletic organizations to strip trans athletes of their records
What It Means: Continued attacks on trans students and athletes.

Name of Action: DOGE cancelation of IES projects
Topic: Research Funding, Federal Workforce, Program Funding
What It Says: Terminated 89 contracts with agencies that do research for IES. Also terminated data collection and US participation in PISA.
What It Means: Potential forthcoming huge gaps in data sets and statistical research. Major hit to orgs that do federally contracted research, like NCES, Mathematica, and IES.
News & Commentary: AERA and COPAFS Statement on the New Administration’s Sudden Termination of National Center for Education Statistics Contracts

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Reduces Burden on Career and Technical Education Programs
Topic: PK-12 Schools, Postsecondary, Regulations
What It Says: Rescinds Biden admin regulations under the Perkins Act for data collection and reporting by CTE programs.
What It Means: The Biden changes were unpopular and even faced opposition from groups like AASA.
News & Commentary: Education Department reverses CTE policies after criticism | K-12 Dive

Name of Action: Supplemental Guidance to the 2024 NIH Grants Policy Statement: Indirect Cost Rates
Topic: Research Funding, Program Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: TRO extended March 5.
What It Means: Would have enormous impact on higher education research.
Challenges to Action: Association of American Universities v. Department of Health & Human Services, 1:25-cv-10346 – CourtListener.com
News & Commentary: AAU Legally Challenges Cuts to Life-Saving NIH Research
Additional Info: Commonwealth of Massachusetts v. National Institutes of Health, 1:25-cv-10338 – CourtListener.com
Fallout: Also a lawsuit from 22 attorneys general.

Name of Action: DoD starts restricting learning materials in DoD schools
Topic: DEI, PK-12 Schools, Federal Workforce
What It Says: Restricting materials that DoD deems out of compliance with DEI Executive Order.
What It Means: Banning materials.

Name of Action: DOGE obtains administrator email accounts from Dept of Education
Topic: Department of Education, Federal Workforce
What It Says: DOGE claims they need access to data to find waste and fraud in programs.
What It Means: No real justification for why personal data would be helpful in assessing fraud and waste.
Status: on 2/24, judge issued injunction on ED sharing personal information with DOGE. Impacts both the student and worker cases.
News & Commentary: Judge blocks Department of Education, federal personnel office from sharing data with DOGE
Notes: Challenges brought by both University of California Student Association (to block DOGE access to loan data) and federal workers unions to block sharing of worker person information.

Name of Action: Dept of Education blocks entry by Democratic lawmakers
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Democratic lawmakers wished to meet with Denise Carter to discuss potential adminstration cuts to programs.
What It Means: No explanation given for blocking access.
News & Commentary: Education Department’s doors blocked to House Democrats | K-12 Dive

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education to Investigate Title IX Violations in Athletics
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, Postsecondary
What It Says: Investigations into schools that allowed trans women to compete in women's sports. Includes San Jose State University, University of Pennsylvania, Massachusetts Interscholastic Atheletics Association.
What It Means: Part of ongoing anti-trans agenda.

Name of Action: DOGE attempts to access federal student data
Topic: Regulations
What It Says: Tried to access federal student data without clearance
What It Means: Clear FERPA violation
Status: TRO granted in part; access blocked until March 10
Challenges to Action: American Federation of Teachers v. Bessent, 8:25-cv-00430 – CourtListener.com

Name of Action: Keeping Men out of Women's Sports
Topic: Regulations, LGBTQ+, Title IX, Civil Rights, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Halts federal funding for educational institutions that allow transgender women and girls to compete in women's and girls' sports.
What It Means: Further adheres to POTUS 2-gender policy. Leaves trans women athletes with no avenues for participation in sports.
Challenges to Action: Students and Families Move to Challenge Trump Executive Order Banning Transgender Sports Participation - GLAD Law
Notes: GLAD is trying to expand a NH state challenge to encompass this EO.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Announces Improvements to the FAFSA Form
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Removed all gender options on the FAFSA except male and female.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Probes Cases of Antisemitism of Five Universities
Topic: DEI, Civil Rights, Antisemitism, Postsecondary
What It Says: Claims there was widespread antisemitic harrassment on campuses during protests against Israel-Hamas war.
What It Means: Implications for free speech

Name of Action: Disbanding of Federal School Safety Clearinghouse External Advisory Board
Topic: PK-12 Schools, Regulations, Governance
What It Says: No explanation given. Members are allowed to reapply for membership of the 26-member commission. Board was charged with advising on school safety issues.
What It Means: Ron Nazoe of NASSP was the chair.
News & Commentary: The Trump administration disbanded a federal school safety board. Now what? | K-12 Dive

Name of Action: Trump admin puts all USAID staff on leave; reduction in force of 1,600 personnel
Topic: Federal Workforce, International Education, Postsecondary Funding, PK-12 School Funding, Program Funding
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Cutting US funding for PK-20 programs around the world.
Notes: Also: pause in foreign assistance funding via USAID on 1/26/25
Additional Info: Implementing the President’s Executive Order on Reevaluating and Realigning United States Foreign Aid

Name of Action: Department of Education workers put on leave
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, Civil Rights
What It Says: 50 ED workers who work on DEI initiatives were put on administrative leave.
What It Means: ED is purging DEI work.
Notes: multiple lawsuits from fed worker unions, but perhaps none specific to ED.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Advances School Choice by Supporting Charter Schools
Topic: School Choice, PK-12 School Funding, Regulations
What It Says: Removed Biden admin requirements for charter certification. Allocated $33 million in grants to charter management organizations.

Name of Action: Enforcement of Executive Order Defending Women
Topic: LGBTQ+, DEI, Regulations, Civil Rights
What It Says: ED OCR reverts Title IX protections to 2020 rules, namely only covering biological women.
What It Means: Trans and nonbinary people no longer have Title IX protections, impacting all postsecondary Title IX offices.

Name of Action: Restoring America's Fighting Force
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, Postsecondary
What It Says: Bans race-conscious admissions at military academies. Also bans race-conscious events and clubs.
What It Means: Supreme Court has explicitly left race-conscious admissions intact for military academies.

Name of Action: Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump's Executive Order Defending Women
Topic: LGBTQ+, DEI, Title IX, Civil Rights
What It Says: Gender data removed from federal websites, including the Youth Risk Behavior Survey.
What It Means: Targets trans and nonbinary people.

Name of Action: Expanding Educational Freedom and Opportunity for Families
Topic: School Choice, PK-12 School Funding
What It Says: Directs agency heads (ED, HHS, DoD, DI) to give guidance to states for expanding school choice.
What It Means: Includes private and faith-based schools.

Name of Action: Ending Radical Endoctrination in K-12 Schooling
Topic: DEI, Civil Rights, Regulations, Program Funding, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Halts funding for schools teaching “radical gender ideology and critical race theory,” requires a plan from the Department of Education on ending “indoctrination in K-12 education” and reinstates the 1776 Commission. (Text from Bloomberg)
What It Means: Attempt to eliminate DEI and gender inclusion in educational institutions. 1776 commission promotes a conservative worldview that minimizes the truth about slavery.

Name of Action: Additional Measures to Combat Antisemitism
Topic: Antisemitism, Civil Rights, DEI, Academic Freedom
What It Says: Directs Justice Department to investigate what it describes as antisemitism on campus and encourages colleges to "monitor for and report activities by alien students and staff."
What It Means: Targets college campuses after protests against Israel-Hamas war and combines focus with POTUS focus on immigration and immigrant students.

Name of Action: U.S. Department of Education Launches Investigation into Denver Public Schools for Converting Girl's Restroom to All-Gender Facility
Topic: DEI, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights, Regulations
What It Says: Investigation over a gender-inclusive bathroom. Denver voted that all schools should have one in 2020.
What It Means: Attacking specific districts that implement inclusive practices.

Name of Action: Freeze on all federal financial assistance programs and supporting activities
Topic: Research Funding, Program Funding, DEI, LGBTQ+, Federal Workforce, PK-12 School Funding, Postsecondary Funding
What It Says: Funding freeze on federal grants and loans across federal agencies. This includes HHS, which oversees Headstart.
What It Means: Rapids rollout with virtually no guidance or communication led to chaos and uncertainty about how federal employees were to carry out the directive. Some agencies couldn't access funds even after the injuction was ordered.
Status: Blocked by court orders, and White House has walked back the memo. Still requiring reviews of programs under EOs.
Primary Source: Trump Orders Pause on Federal Financial Assistance | Lawfare
Challenges to Action: NATIONAL COUNCIL OF NONPROFITS v. OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET, 1:25-cv-00239 – CourtListener.com
News & Commentary: Statement of AAU President Barbara Snyder on January 27 OMB Memo Pausing American Scientific Advancement

Name of Action: Protecting Children from Chemical and Surgical Mutilation
Topic: Healthcare, LGBTQ+, Civil Rights
What It Says: Halts federal funding for gender-affirming care for minors, including to hospitals and medical schools. Reverses Title IX protections for transgender people.
What It Means: Further adheres to POTUS 2-gender policy. Could have implications for school, including mental health and medical services.

Name of Action: End to Biden-Era book ban investigations
Topic: Civil Rights, Curriculum
What It Says: Ends ED OCR investigations into complaints of book bans. Biden admin said that book bans could infringe on civil rights.
What It Means: Schools and municipalities might have greater latitude in restricting books available to students and the public.
News & Commentary: Education Department rescinds Biden-era book ban guidance | K-12 Dive

Name of Action: Dept of Ed appointments and nominations
Topic: Federal Workforce
What It Says: Rachel Oglesby, Jonathan Pidluzny, Chase Forrester, Steve Warzoha, Tom Wheeler, Craig Trainor, Madi Bierdermann, Candice Jackson, Joshua Kleinfeld, Hannah Ruth Earl
What It Means: Strong presence of alums from America First Policy Institute

Name of Action: ICE entry into schools, colleges, houses of worship (can't find formal title; directive from Acting Secretary)
Topic: Immigration, Civil Rights
What It Says: ICE and other immigration agents can enter houses of worship, schools, and colleges to apprehend people.
What It Means: Major change to longstanding practice of foregoing entering sensitive/protected areas like schools, churches, shelters.
Challenges to Action: Denver Public Schools v. Noem, 1:25-cv-00474 – CourtListener.com
Additional Info: MENNONITE CHURCH USA v. U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY, 1:25-cv-00403 – CourtListener.com
Fallout: Philadelphia Yearly Meeting of the Religious Society of Friends v. U.S. Department of Homeland..., 8:25-cv-00243 – CourtListener.com

Name of Action: Ending Illegal Discrimination and Restoring Merit-based Opportunity
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, PK-12 Schools, Postsecondary, Civil Rights
What It Says: Another facet of DEI ban
What It Means: Lays out adminstration rationale for DEI ban as a violation of civil rights law.
Notes: Legal challenge brought by National Association of Diversity Officers in Higher Education

Name of Action: Ending Radical and Wasteful Government DEI Programs and Preferencing
Topic: DEI, Federal Workforce, Civil Rights, Postsecondary, PK-12 Schools
What It Says: Terminates DEI efforts in federal government, including positions. Also covers federal contracts and grants.
What It Means: Major uncertainty for compliace by PK-20 institutions under contract.
Status: Feb. 21: federal judge temporarily blocked Trump from terminating contracts that the admin considers equity-oriented.
Notes: This is the same legal challenge as the EO above.

Name of Action: Return to In-Person Work
Topic: Federal Workforce
What It Says: Requires all federal employees, including Department of Ed, to return to in-person work. Deadline Feb 24 for most and June 1 for some.

Name of Action: Nomination of Penny Schwinn for Deputy Secretary of Education
Topic: Federal Workforce, Department of Education
What It Says: Description in title.
News & Commentary: CCSSO Releases Statement on Nomination of Deputy Secretary of Education

Name of Action: Nomination of Linda McMahon for Sec of Education
Topic: Department of Education
What It Says: Description in title.
What It Means: Further evidence of Trump commitment to dismantle ED, put forward far-right education agenda.
Primary Source: Statement by President-elect Donald J. Trump Announcing the Nomination of Linda McMahon as Secretary of Education
